scripts.start:comment: Starts both frontend (port 3000) and backend (port 5000) servers concurrently with color-coded output
scripts.start:frontend:comment: Starts only the React development server on port 3000
scripts.start:backend:comment: Starts only the backend notification server on port 5000
scripts.dev:comment: Development mode with --kill-others-on-fail: stops all servers if one fails
scripts.build:comment: Creates optimized production build in /build directory
scripts.test:comment: Runs Jest tests in watch mode
scripts.eject:comment: WARNING: One-way operation. Ejects from Create React App configuration
scripts.deploy:comment: Builds and deploys to GitHub Pages
scripts.emulators:comment: Starts Firebase local emulators for testing
scripts.deploy:firebase: npm run build && firebase deploy --only hosting
scripts.deploy:firebase:comment: Builds and deploys the frontend to Firebase Hosting (free tier)
scripts.deploy:hosting: npm run build && firebase deploy --only hosting
scripts.deploy:hosting:comment: Builds and deploys only the hosting (frontend)
scripts.deploy:all:comment: Deploys everything (requires Blaze plan for Functions)

concurrentlyOptions.--prefix-colors: Colors for process output (cyan for frontend, magenta for backend)
concurrentlyOptions.--prefix: Format for output prefix ([{name}] shows process name)
concurrentlyOptions.--kill-others-on-fail: Stops all processes if any one fails (used in dev script)

usage.recommended: npm start - Starts both servers with one command
usage.development: npm run dev - Stricter mode that stops all on failure
usage.separate: Use start:frontend or start:backend to run individually
